column1: Uncontrolled data used in path expression
column2: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.
Interpreting unsanitized user input as code allows a malicious user to perform arbitrary code execution.
column4: This code execution depends on a [["user-provided value"|"relative:///CWE-094-author_1.py:1:26:1:32"]].

column2: Leaking information about an exception, such as messages and stack traces, to an external user can expose implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.
column4: [["Stack trace information"|"relative:///CWE-094-author_1.py:42:25:42:25"]] flows to this location and may be exposed to an external user.

column1: Flask app is run in debug mode
column2: Running a Flask app in debug mode may allow an attacker to run arbitrary code through the Werkzeug debugger.
column4: A Flask app appears to be run in debug mode. This may allow an attacker to run arbitrary code through the debugger.
